itemDescription: Welsh rugby union footballer, and rugby league footballer and coach (1942-2018)

wikipedia_page.main: John Mantle (13 March 1942 – 18 November 2018) was a Welsh dual-code international rugby player. He was capped for Wales at rugby union, and Great Britain and Wales in rugby league.

response: Whilst at Warrington, he was picked as captain of the Great Britain Under-24 team, and he played his last match for Warrington on Saturday 8 February 1964. He then moved onto St. Helens (84 appearances 1964-1966) starring in one of the all-time great packs alongside legends such as Ray French, Cliff Watson, and fellow Welshmen Kel Coslett, John Warlow and John Mantle, and also winning selection for Commonwealth XIII and full caps for Great Britain.

link_mentions.page: List of St Helens R.F.C. players
